greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of sqrt(13)/2.
comment: In a regular hexagon inscribed in a circle of radius R the largest distance between any vertex and a midpoint of a side, after division of R, is sqrt(13)/2. The two smaller distance ratios are sqrt(7)/2 = A242703 and 1/2.
The regular period 6 continued fraction of sqrt(13)/2 is [1; 1, 4, 14, 4, 1, 2], and the convergents are given in A295331/A295332.
Essentially the same as A223139, A209927, A098316 and A085550. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 23 2017
results.author: _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 20 2017
